CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 23, 1957, pg. A12 reads: "Bethel Begins Drive For $350,000 - Forced to seek a new place of worship, Bethel AME Church, Elm and Wylie, staged a kick-off dinner Feb. 15 to raise $350,000 to pay for a new and modern church.  Pictured above are leaders in drive.  Left to right: Clifton Poinsette, chairman; the Rev. John D. Bright, minister of Bethel AME Church, Philadelphia, who was the main speaker, and the Rev. and Mrs. Charles Spivey. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Clifton Poinsette, Rev. John D. Bright, shaking hand of Mrs. Charles Spivey, Rev. Charles Spivey, Mrs. Charles Jones wearing corsage, and unknown man, gathered at banquet for Bethel AME Church fundraiser
